title: Triangle Angle Sum Theorem (Correct)
theorem: The sum of interior angles in any triangle equals 180°
given: Triangle ABC with interior angles ∠A = α, ∠B = β, ∠C = γ

steps.content: Construct line DE through vertex A such that DE || BC
Since DE || BC and AB is a transversal, alternate interior angles are equal: ∠DAB = ∠ABC = β
Since DE || BC and AC is a transversal, alternate interior angles are equal: ∠EAC = ∠ACB = γ
Angles DAB, BAC, and EAC form a straight angle along line DE, so ∠DAB + ∠BAC + ∠EAC = 180°
Substituting: β + α + γ = 180°, which proves the triangle angle sum theorem
